text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a creamy mushroom pasta young
young
this is named after a friend of the site
Wendy Chang wather 'aa blog sister dot
blog spot.com her blog regularly wins
the top Asian blog award year after year
this pasta dish is dedicated to her was
a special request she actually won a
man's heart making my chocolate lava
cake recipe so even though her real name
is Fischer I mean it's pronounced
basically just like it's spelled C and
her English name is Wendy her friends
call her Union according to her it gives
her a warm and tingly feeling so that's
what this dish is named for all right so
we're going to start with some shiitake
mushroom that's about four ounces of
shiitake you don't want to eat the stems
okay the stems are too tough and fibrous
so just trim the stems off and then
slice those up and I also have 3/4 of a
pound of just white button mushrooms
also slice then so about a pound of
mushrooms all together so we're going to
put those aside all right now in a pan
in a little bit of olive oil I'm going
to saute the mushrooms until nicely
browned and this is going to take a
while you're going to give it a little
pinch of salt and on medium heat you're
just going to let them cook and slowly
reduce and saute all right in the
meantime we'll get the rest of our
ingredients together all right I want
you to pour 2 ounces of sherry wine I
want you to drink it then I want you to
pour 2 more ounces that we're going to
use for the sauce later all right that
takes the edge off you got to be very
calm when you make this recipe we're
also going to get some fresh herbs the
tarragon is a nice kind of sweet kind of
licorice e flavor
all right the chive is a nice little
onion flavor and the thyme gives it a
nice fresh citrusy kind of lemony aroma
very subtle that's why we're not using a
ton so now you see there the water is
kind of leaked out of the mushroom the
salt draws out the water and then if
you're patient the water will evaporate
and it will start to saute this takes a
while be patient you can't rush these
all right there called mushrooms not
rush rooms so you just got to relax take
your time
you want them nice and brown just like
that once they're brown you're going to
throw in your garlic that's 2 cloves of
crushed garlic you're going to saute
that for 1 minute only you want to Brown
the garlic just want to give it a little
saute real quick then we're going to
throw in our sherry wine
we're going to reduce that and when you
see it almost gone you're going to put
in a cup of chicken stock now if you
want this vegetarian go ahead and use
vegetable stock or mushroom stock all
right little black pepper a little
another pinch of salt and we're just
going to let that simmer for about five
minutes on medium and the stock is going
to flavor the mushrooms and the
mushrooms is going to flavor the stock
and it's all going to be so delicious
I'm going to pour in a cup of cream this
is regular heavy whipping cream you're
going to bring that to a simmer on
medium and that's going to cook for
about five minutes and you'll see it
kind of starts off kind of loose a
little bit watery and then in just a few
minutes it's going to thicken up a
little bit now you don't want it too
thick because it'll be too sticky on the
pasta so just about 5-6 minutes is fine
in fact you can reduce it about the same
time it takes to cook the pasta which is
usually you know six seven eight minutes
so in boiling salted water I cooked 8
ounces of fettuccine you can use any
pasta one of course we're going to drain
the pasta while the pasta is draining do
not rinse it while the pasta is draining
we're going to add our fresh herbs to
the sauce you're going to stir that in
and then we're going to turn off the
heat and dump in a half a cup of real
Parmesan cheese the Reggiano parmesan
the real stuff from Italy don't use the
stuff out of the canister we're a poured
in stirred around and again the heat is
off the heat is off you'd never cook
cheese at the end of a pasta all right
I'm going to put my pasta in a large
serving bowl it has not been rinsed it's
been drained so there's a little fine
layer of starch on the pasta we're going
to pour over the mushroom sauce and half
the mushrooms I'm going to save some
mushrooms for the top and we're just
going to toss that and that beautiful
aromatic mushroom sauce creamy sauce is
going to stick to the pasta the pasta
like I said has a little bit of starch
on the outside it's just going to suck
in that sauce so once that's all tossed
and nicely coated go ahead and garnish
the top with the rest of your mushrooms
that way you know you have some nice
mushrooms on top they're not all mixed
in that is a magnificent pasta dish I'm
not sure if it's like the one that Union
has in you know
Singapore but it's delicious and I hope
she likes it and I hope you like it and
I hope you give it a try anyway thanks

yen which is what you know friends
